algebraic_word_problem: A man can complete a work task in 12 hours. If he works for 5 hours and then another person takes over and finishes the task in 7 hours, how long would it take the second person to complete the entire task alone?
step_by_step_solution: Work done by man in 5 hours = 5/12 of the task. Remaining work = 1 - (5/12) = 7/12. If second person finishes it in 7 hours, then his rate = (7/12)/7 = 1/12. Therefore, he can complete the task in 12 hours.
